{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient's symptoms of amenorrhea, binge eating, and calluses on the dorsum of her hands suggest that she may be suffering from bulimia nervosa, an eating disorder characterized by episodes of binge eating followed by compensatory behaviors such as vomiting. The enlarged cheeks could be due to swollen salivary glands, a common finding in individuals who frequently induce vomiting. Frequent vomiting can also lead to erosion of tooth enamel due to the acidity of the stomach contents.", "answer_choice": "C. Erosion of tooth enamel"}
